authorReco.eval

Class RecognizerPerformance

  • java.lang.Object
    • authorReco.eval.RecognizerPerformance

  • public class RecognizerPerformance
extends java.lang.Object
    Class RecognizerPerformance: class to compute the performance of a recognition system.
    Author:
    N. Hernandez and S. Quiniou (2017)

      Method using the sentences given in two lists to compute the accuracy of a recognition system, i.e. the number of sentences whose author is correctly recognized by the system.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public static double evaluate(java.lang.String refAuthorPath,
                              java.lang.String hypAuthorPath)
        Method using the sentences given in two files to compute the accuracy of a recognition system, i.e. the number of sentences whose author is correctly recognized by the system. The first file contains the author annotation of each sentence of a reference file and the second file contains the hypothesis author of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        refAuthorPath - the path of the file containing the reference annotation of sentences of the reference file.
        hypAuthorPath - the path of the file containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        the accuracy of the recognition system.

      • evaluate

        public static double evaluate(java.util.List<java.lang.String> refAuthor,
                              java.util.List<java.lang.String> hypAuthor)
        Method using the sentences given in two lists to compute the accuracy of a recognition system, i.e. the number of sentences whose author is correctly recognized by the system. The first list contains the author annotation of each sentence of a reference list and the second list contains the hypothesis author of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        refAuthor - the list containing the reference annotation of the sentences of a reference list.
        hypAuthor - the list containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        the accuracy of the recognition system.

      • evaluateAuthors

        public static java.lang.String evaluateAuthors(java.lang.String refAuthorPath,
                                               java.lang.String hypAuthorPath)
        Method using the sentences given in two files to compute the accuracy of a recognition system for each author, i.e. the number of sentences whose author is correctly recognized by the system. The first file contains the author annotation of each sentence of a reference file and the second file contains the hypothesis author of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        refAuthorPath - the path of the file containing the reference annotation of a sentences of the reference file.
        hypAuthorPath - the path of the file containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        a String containing the accuracy of the recognition system for each author.

      • evaluateAuthors

        public static java.lang.String evaluateAuthors(java.util.List<java.lang.String> refAuthor,
                                               java.util.List<java.lang.String> hypAuthor)
        Method using the sentences given in two lists to compute the accuracy of a recognition system for each author, i.e. the number of sentences whose author is correctly recognized by the system. The first list contains the author annotation of each sentence of a reference list and the second list contains the hypothesis author of each reference sentence as given by the recognition system whose performance is evaluated.
        Parameters:
        refAuthor - the list containing the reference annotation of the sentences of a reference list.
        hypAuthor - the list containing the hypothesis sentences given by a recognition system.
        Returns:
        a String containing the accuracy of the recognition system for each author.
